Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: Let people pick any combination of 5 lectures they attend
They could bring in better speakers. Some of these speakers were just not interesting or lacked the ability to be presenters. Maybe poll the students on what they'd like to see?
Joel was the most engaging speaker this semester, and I took a lot from his presentation
Interesting talks and free lunch were great.
Its strengths are the variety of speakers. It would be interesting to have community leaders or more diverse people present

This seminar is great. It brings in a number of diverse researchers that are doing different things in the public health field. It has expanded my mind as to what is included in public health and where I could potentially go after graduation.

Honestly, these were interesting and Im so glad our note about the kale apple salad was heard! However, I have no feelings about this seminar. I learn something new ever few Thursdays and that was it.
Always great to hear from professionals in our field and being able to engage with them afterwards.
I really enjoyed the seminars this semester. I think there could have been more clarity/communication about the seminar schedule and whether they were required or not.
Did not have much interaction so I don't feel I can adequately answer this question.
As mentioned above, Peng also does a great job with the seminar. The environment is constructive and exploratory of new topics. This is in large part to Peng and the support of the SBS community.
Did not have much interaction so I don't feel I can adequately answer this question.

Yusuf does a great job during the seminar. He creates a good environment where people feel comfortable to ask questions. He brings in amazing people that are inspiring in their research. Overall, he is an excellent instructor for the seminar.
Interesting talks and free lunch with peers from your department.
There are a lot of interesting topics to hear about
Yes, I would recommend this course. It helps explore the field of SBS and the limitless possibilities of where to go after graduation.
You get free lunch and you have a speaker most Thursdays. There isnt much to it.
Seminar is a great way to hear and learn from scholars outside Yale who are doing some really cool SBS-type work!
